A connection of mine (Manager at Abra, a Large Crypto Asset Manager) is interested in hiring summer interns focusing their trading & investment team (quantitative). This position is not open to the general public, so I am only emailing specific groups that I think will be a good fit! Email me if interested (raymondchong@berkeley.edu).

Investment Research and Analyst Intern at Large Crypto Asset Manager

The analyst will work closely with the investment and research team to evaluate fundamentals of blockchain protocols that will inform investment decisions, as well as build models to inform portfolio allocation.

Key Responsibilities

  • ●  Review potential digital asset protocol investments and prepare one-page investment memorandums analyzing the value prop of digital asset networks, the technology and design, potential use cases, governance mechanisms and adoption curves. This will require some understanding of the technology in the underlying digital asset networks, economics and traditional finance.

  • ●  Explore and research the decentralized finance (DeFi) space, including decentralized lending and trading platforms and conduct analysis on various yield generating activities and associated risks.

  • ●  Evaluate and work with data sources and conduct statistical analysis in connection with portfolio analysis, investment strategies and models.

    Skillset Requirements

    Computer Science majors strongly preferred.
    Strong analytical skills.
    Familiarity with portfolio construction analytics and some exposure to quantitative portfolio management.
    Some knowledge of digital assets and blockchain is desirable, but not required.
    Fairly strong mathematical and statistical modeling skills desired.

    About Abra

    Abra.com is cryptocurrency asset manager that has raised $90 M + in venture funding from First Round Capital, RRE Ventures, American Express among others. Abra Capital Management is the investment arm of Abra that focuses on thematic investment in Web 3 protocols and DeFi.
